Articles.Content:
adsii1970's sandbox micro-challenges

20221217:  This thread has been updated and reformatted to work better on most devices. The challenge threads were edited to stack the stock and modded challenge requirements rather than to list them side by side. After it was reported to me, and verified, it appears that Apple devices and some browsers were not displaying the complete table.

A couple of days ago I was asked on one of the Facebook groups if I would post some micro-challenge/mission ideas for those who are looking for some sort of objective in playing a sandbox game. I asked around as a profile status post to see what everyone's thoughts were. And after careful consideration, I've decided to create an entire thread of micro-challenges for those interested.

I play with mods and expect that many of you do, too. Here are the mods which will make the micro-challenges easier for you:

  • Kerbal Engineer Redux
  • Mechjeb for all
  • Kerbal Planetary Base Systems
  • Stockalike Station Parts Expansion Redux
  • Snacks!

By no means do you have to complete the challenges with mods, you can complete them without mods.* And you can use other mods besides these. For many of us "older" KSP players, these challenges are pretty easy but still fun. For a newbie who is just getting the hang of the game, they can be challenging and rewarding.

For now, the sandbox micro-challenges will only include the stock system. If there's interest in more development of the challenges, I will add missions which will incorporate the Outer Planets Mod. Each micro-challenge will fall into one or more categories.

Each micro-challenge will come with it's own leader board and signature image. Every three weeks, I will release a new micro-challenge. You do not have to do all the micro-challenges posted; simply choose the ones which interest you. You are free to use the most recently posted challenge or you can use one of the older ones.

The edit of December 17, 2022 changed the format of the OP. To keep things tidy, I placed each of the stock bodies of the Kerbol system in their own heading and a spoiler under the heading where each mission will have a link. I think it will work better than the previous tables that caused some forum members to have issues with the extreme ends of the tables not properly displaying on certain web browsers. For now, there are placeholder entries for those planets and satellites (and Kerbol) where I haven't shared a mission (yet). Don't worry, there will be missions to those far away destinations.  

Here are the rules/guidelines for the challenges:

  • Once you've completed the micro-challenge, simply post to this thread and share images or video which shows your progress and completion of the challenge - and be sure to include the name of the challenge in your post.
  • If you are using images, please embed them in a spoiler. Many people have complained that excessive images not in spoilers cause lag issues on older or mobile devices. Using spoilers seems to help with this.
  • On that challenge's post, I'll add your name to the leader board and a link to your post for others to easily find what was done to complete the micro-challenge.

The challenges are rated on a three-tiered scale of an easy, medium, or hard challenge. There are a few followers of this thread who assist me in rating the challenges. If you are interested in helping me rate the challenge, send me a private message and I'll add you to the group. A description of the challenge levels are below:

Rating Description
These missions can usually be completed in one to three launches and require the very basic skills of spaceflight in Kerbal Space Program. These skills include rendezvous, docking, and achieving polar or circular orbits within the Kerbin sphere of influence. Some of these missions do include the designing of specialized craft to perform certain functions.
These missions can be a little more challenging and while can be completed in one to seven launches, in addition to requiring the basic skills of spaceflight, landing a probe, lander, or assemble a station on a natural satellite or planet.
These missions are hard and involve the construction of space stations, planetary bases, and such which should ideally be constructed in multiple launches and assembled in place.

There are some who have provided feedback saying they intend to play these in career mode to make them even more challenging. That's fine - these missions are simply meant to be a springboard to help you sharpen your skills.

Chouette idée

Minmus space station micro-challenge

This challenge involves constructing a fully operational space station in orbit of Minmus.

Here are the requirements for your space station:

Modded game Stock game
+ Station must comfortably house six Kerbalnauts + Station must comfortably house six Kerbalnauts
+ Station must be at an orbit between 56Km to 65Km + Station must be at an orbit between 56Km to 65Km
+ Station must rely on solar power only (batteries and capacitors ok) + Station must rely on solar power only (batteries ok)
+ Station must be able to remain in contact with the KSC (relay ok) + Station must be able to remain in contact with the KSC (relay ok)
+ Station must have two docking ports (minimum) + Station must have two docking ports (minimum)
+ Station must include a lab, mystery goo container, and a lander + Station must include a lab, mystery goo container, and a lander
+ One docking port must be available to ferry Kerbalnauts to and from Kerbin + One docking port must be available to ferry Kerbalnauts to and from Kerbin
+ Station must be able to provide food/snacks for six Kerbalnauts (greenhouse)  

Additional information about the challenge:

  • The lander must be capable of taking a crew of two Kerbalnauts to the surface of Minmus and return.
  • Your station design must include fuel storage tanks for monopropellant and Liquid Fuel/Oxygen (if you're like me and love continuing the use of space stations, this can become a great starting place for the continued exploration of Minmus).
  • Your space station needs to be ASSEMBLED in the orbit of Minmus. This means multiple launches.
  • There is no preferred shape for your station! As long as it meets the above criteria, you're good to go.

The sandbox micro-challenge badge:

@Kerbolitto - MSS - 1

@scarecrow09 - station in a 60k x 58k orbit

@Spaceman.Spiff - The Neptune

Return to the OP

Edited August 30, 2018 by Kerbolitto

@Kerbolitto: Thanks for sharing! And it's exactly one of the reasons I thought about sharing these self-imposed missions!

Sometimes we get so bogged down in the spreadsheets we forget the joy of this game. In my regular saved game, I've gotten to the point I am concentrating so much I don't even listen to the Bach or Beethoven playing in the background. Silly me, I thought games were to be fun!

And you're right. Having fun and easy challenges are a great way to truly get an evening's enjoyment with little effort!

3 minutes ago, adsii1970 said:

Sometimes we get so bogged down in the spreadsheets we forget the joy of this game. In my regular saved game, I've gotten to the point I am concentrating so much I don't even listen to the Bach or Beethoven playing in the background. Silly me, I thought games were to be fun!

I know the feeling, with Duna architecture outpost for example :p

To me this game is always fun but we got to find some kind of a frame to enjoy it, even on career mode things becomes quite easy and repetitive .. But this sort of guideline is very enjoyable, we can focus on a global mission instead of improving every little bits to maximize the overall efficiency !

You already got some ideas for the next challenges ? =)

These first few missions are all fairly easy. But they do involve multiple launches.

Hi @adsii1970!

Glad you posted this. With your thread and the General Micro challenge thread, I'm sure I'll be busy!

*Looks at tags*
Ooooh! Shinies! 

I like those...

It's been a while since I've done missions to Minmus so thought I would give this one a go.

My station ended up in a 60k x 58k orbit.  It includes the required Mystery Goo canister (2) as well as fuel and monoprop capacity.  3 docking ports are available; one is used for the lander, one is for refuelling purposes and the final one is dedicated to visiting ships and transfer shuttles for crew exchanges.  The station was built with 4 launches; station core, comms and solar module, fuel module, and science lab module.  Two further launches were made, one to deliver the lander, and the second to bring up the crew.  Crew changes in future will be made using a shuttle from a station in LKO, and crew being transferred from that station to and from the surface of Kerbin using a SSTO.


 

Spoiler

 

First I put a relay satellite in a big orbit, as the construction launches would be controlled by probes.

 

This shows the relay orbit and the working relay lines of communication

 

Before delivering the core, the modules were placed in arbitrary orbits around Minmus

 

The core being placed in final orbit

 

The fuel module being delivered.  The comms/solar module is already in place and deployed

 

The science lab module about to be attached

 

The final station, before the addition of the lander or crew

 

The lander attached after delivery

 

After crewing, the lander departs for it's first visit to the surface

 

Safely down with flag planted to mark the occasion.  The lander has enough fuel for two return trips before needing to be refuelled
Yay!

On 9/4/2018 at 6:03 PM, W. Kerman said:

Yay!

One of my goals is to build up a bunch of mini-missions which can be used to springboard more challenging missions...

Mün Arch Settlement micro-challenge

I almost ran out of week before I had a chance to post this week's micro-challenge. This challenge involves constructing a fully operational settlement near one of the arches on the Mün.

Here are the requirements for your space station:

Modded game Stock game
+ Settlement must comfortably house ten Kerbalnauts + Settlement must comfortably house ten Kerbalnauts
+ Settlement must no further than 1 Km and no closer than 500 m to arch. + Settlement must no further than 1 Km and no closer than 500 m to arch.
+ Settlement must be able to process ore into fuel. + Settlement must be able to process ore into fuel.
+ Settlement must be able to remain in contact with the KSC (relay ok) + Settlement must be able to remain in contact with the KSC (relay ok)
+ Settlement must have a science lab. + Settlement must have a science lab.
+ Settlement must be able to refuel a lander or other craft. + Settlement must be able to refuel a lander or other craft.
+ Settlement must have an airlock to allow passage from outside/in, etc. + Settlement must have an airlock to allow passage from outside/in, etc.
+ Station must be able to provide food/snacks for ten Kerbalnauts (greenhouse)  

Additional information about the challenge:

  • Your settlement will need power. You will need to use nuclear power, solar power, batteries, or whatever to assure your Kerbalnauts aren't left in the dark and to have enough power to process ore into fuel.
  • You must provide housing for all ten Kerbalnauts - no hot bunking!
  • There's no predefined shape for your settlement. Have fun!
  • You will need to have some sort of rover which can be used to drill for ore and bring it back to the settlement for processing (for future micro-challenges).
  • You will need a docking port (unmodded) or the hose connector found in KAS/KIS (modded) on your settlement. This will allow you to transfer ore for processing and refined fuel to be exported to various craft.

The sandbox micro-challenge badge:

@Kerbolitto -  Mün Settlement

Cool challenge!

On it.

I'll be back.
I might look into this. I haven't done a micro-challenge yet funnily enough.

I present you my attempt at Mun Settlement challenge !

 

I went a bit overboard with the station's design but somehow everything works

 

Kerbin lift-off and Mun capture

 

Spoiler

Lift off : I had to use my biggest cargo SSTO (500t.) because I forgot where I put a lighter one ..

The station being quite light, I managed to complete the whole Mun injection with the 1st stage, throwing it in an impact on the Mun before separation of 2nd stage.

Mun's capture, very elliptical orbit to change plane at Ap. I set the station on a polar orbit to wait a good opportunity to deorbit on an Arch :

 

Mun maneuvers and deorbit

 

Spoiler

Polar maneuver at Ap :

Deorbit maneuver after waiting 4/5 days to pass above the arch, I did not choose the equatorial one because I wanted to visit another one ! During this time I set up a relay network using 2 lights probes on polar orbits :

 

Landing and unpacking !

 

Spoiler

Here is the outpost just after touchdown, I used a Cheetah to slow down the assembly while tipping horizontal. There's a lot of fuel left since the SSTO was able to finish the Mun's burn :

After mining south of the station, the rover is re-attached on it with 600 ore.

 

So here it is !

Shining Currents is operationnal. This outpost has everything required, with industrial refuelling capacity. It also possesses 2 normal and 1 senior docking ports facing upwards to allow vertical dockings. It is also capable of producing science experiments and looks really cool in the night !

 

Edited September 10, 2018 by Kerbolitto

Haven't forgotten this challenge... Just having "technical difficulties" 

Spoiler

5 hours ago, W. Kerman said:

Haven't forgotten this challenge... Just having "technical difficulties"

Might be clipping between upper and lower deck (ISRU wobbles into ore tank, that'd be my guess), maybe over stress of landing gears  .. Try adding some struts between your decks ? Also on Mun surface this may not happen, I too had troubles with landing gears but they suffer less pressure on the lower gravity. Did you cheat this outpost on the Mun ?

7 hours ago, Kerbolitto said:

Might be clipping between upper and lower deck (ISRU wobbles into ore tank, that'd be my guess), maybe over stress of landing gears  .. Try adding some struts between your decks ? Also on Mun surface this may not happen, I too had troubles with landing gears but they suffer less pressure on the lower gravity. Did you cheat this outpost on the Mun ?

No, I scrapped the base after reworking it for awhile, and came up with a design that doesn’t immediately detonate on stage seperation.

@adsii1970

I built a station around Minmus over Christmas break

Here it is! The Neptune 

I only discovered this challenge today, and since I'm finally getting a chance to play some KSP, I decided to see what needed to be done to get this bad boy up to code.

So as you can see I have pretty much everything; all the science, all the habitation space, and all the POWAH!! We have comms, docking ports, etc. 

However, there are a few glaring problems. 

  1. I don't have a lander
  2. There is no greenhouse, which I have decided to add even though I don't use LS
  3. Lastly, and most annoyingly, I am in too low of an orbit. ugh.

Greenhouse first:

Sunrise dawns on this hideous approximation of a Vulcan.

Liftoff!

Alright! Orbit confirmed!

Onto Minmus!

lol I just realized the windows watermark is on all of these. D'oh!

Mid course correction

We're here! And on an intercept course with the station.

That is a pretty shot.

Docking Successful!

One objective down, two to go! 

Although now that I think about, why not take out two planes with one launch? We have that perfectly good Poodle engine sitting there......

Although it's not the design orientation, there's no denying that this looks cool.

Apomin raise maneuver.

Final Maneuver to reach the desired 60x60 km. orbit.

I keep telling myself that I'm prolonging this process a lot by taking so many screenshots. 

What can I say? This station is pretty darn photogenic.

Final maneuver!

YES! A NICE, ROUND ORBIT!!!!

It worked!

Spoiler

I really wasn't planning that. I realized in transit, 

huh, I'm docking this inline, and it has an engine, I should use that!

It saved me a bunch of pain.

 

Anyways, it's LanderTime!

A different crappy Vulcan.

FYI I'm going to take fewer pictures for this launch and TMI. It is very time consuming.

Simpler times. 

I know I said fewer pic, but I didn't get booster sep last time.

Minmus approach

Mibles Kerman using the brilliant PCS suit by OrdinaryKerman

Success! The station is now in compliance with challenge rules!

I know it's been a few years, and this challenge is a bit old, but with your improved badge making skillz, would you consider upgrading this one? 

I will wear it with pride either way

@Spaceman.Spiff

Towards the end of the month, I will be adding more challenges (about one a month) and revamping the thread. The idea behind this is to provide some challenges to those who want to find enjoyment of the sandbox game but do not have any idea where to start with mission planning.

I already have a plan for what will happen with these smaller sandbox challenges. Each one can be done independently - just for the fun of doing them. But I'd suggest keeping the progress you make. Because, over time, there will be missions which the only way to complete them is to have some of the earlier, foundational missions already complete. In the end, I think it will be fun to see what kinds of things folks come up with to get the job done.

And yes, I plan to redo ALL of the images for this challenge thread. I am playing around with a couple of ideas to make them more aesthetically pleasing and meaningful.

When I update the thread, I will give you credit for each of the challenges you've completed. Thanks for showing interest in this thread.
